22  package lombok.extern.apachecommons;
23  
24  import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
25  import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
26  import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
27  import java.lang.annotation.Target;
28  
29  /**
30   * Causes lombok to generate a logger field.
31   * <p>
32   * Complete documentation is found at <a href="https://projectlombok.org/features/log">the project lombok features page for lombok log annotations</a>.
33   * <p>
34   * Example:
35   * <pre>
36   * &#64;CommonsLog
37   * public class LogExample {
38   * }
39   * </pre>
40   * 
41   * will generate:
42   * 
43   * <pre>
44   * public class LogExample {
45   *     private static final org.apache.commons.logging.Log log = org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory.getLog(LogExample.class);
46   * }
47   * </pre>
48   * 
49   * This annotation is valid for classes and enumerations.<br>
50   * 
51   * @see <a href="https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-logging/apidocs/org/apache/commons/logging/Log.html">org.apache.commons.logging.Log</a>
52   * @see <a href="https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-logging/apidocs/org/apache/commons/logging/LogFactory.html#getLog(java.lang.Class)">org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory#getLog(java.lang.Class)</a>
53   * @see lombok.extern.java.Log &#64;Log
54   * @see lombok.extern.log4j.Log4j &#64;Log4j
55   * @see lombok.extern.log4j.Log4j2 &#64;Log4j2
56   * @see lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j &#64;Slf4j
57   * @see lombok.extern.slf4j.XSlf4j &#64;XSlf4j
58   * @see lombok.extern.jbosslog.JBossLog &#64;JBossLog
59   * @see lombok.extern.flogger.Flogger &#64;Flogger
60   * @see lombok.CustomLog &#64;CustomLog
61   */
62  @Retention(RetentionPolicy.SOURCE)
63  @Target(ElementType.TYPE)
64  public @interface CommonsLog {
65  	/** @return The category of the constructed Logger. By default, it will use the type where the annotation is placed. */
66  	String topic() default "";
67  }
